scene.name: intro
scene.line: Here it is. Now, I have to ask, as a matter of course: what kind of experience do you have driving trucks?
scene.option: I drove deliveries for an antique shop, up until this last run.
I used to drive long hauls.

scene.name: antiques
scene.line: Aha, precious cargo ... you'll do just fine.

scene.name: long-hauls
scene.line: It's a lonely kind of thing, or so I hear.

scene.name: safety
scene.line: And you can drive ... `safely`, can't you?
I haven't any doubt, now, it's only ... after what happened with Miguel this evening.
scene.option: What happened with Miguel this evening?
I've been driving all my life, for better or worse.

scene.name: what-happened
scene.line: Well, the dust is still clearing, of course. Perhaps he closed his eyes a moment. Or simply hit a curve too devilish.

scene.name: all-my-life
scene.line: I suppose that's all you must say? I like that. Never say more than you must — it's boastful, and ugly.

scene.name: miguel
scene.line: I do pity ill-fated Miguel — he was good company, and slow to anger. But, if we're speaking confidentially ...
Well, with all that lost `product` to be repaid — bourbon and glass dashed across the interstate, and a few casks too — we're all just thankful he had no ... next of kin.
So. Let's see if we can ring up the dispatcher.
